intro: Rytigynia ruwenzoriensis, commonly known as the Ruwenzori rytigynia, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Ruwenzori Mountains in East Africa. It belongs to the family Rytigyniaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically red or orange in color. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to the cool, moist conditions of its mountainous habitat. It is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
